title: Khashoggi murder: US softens towards Saudi leader
description: Saudi Arabia's crown prince was shunned after the 2018 killing, but the kingdom is back in business.

title: Summer of Soul: New film revives lost 'Black Woodstock' gig series
description: Questlove's directorial debut uncovers lost gigs with Sly Stone, Stevie Wonder and Nina Simone.

title: Ros Atkins on... the trouble at Wembley
description: Ros Atkins looks at how crowd problems at Wembley played out from Sunday morning until after the final of Euro 2020.

title: The woman giving toys a new life
description: Rebecca transforms people's old and unwanted dolls and then gives them away for free.

title: A question of faith: Biden, Catholicism and the presidency
description: A debate over communion for the second Catholic US president renews questions of religion and politics.

title: Rashford could miss two months of season due to shoulder operation
description: Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford could miss the first two months of the season after deciding to have surgery on a shoulder injury.

title: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn: How I escaped Japan in a box
description: The former boss of Nissan and Renault reveals how he evaded house arrest to flee to Lebanon.

title: Stalking incidents increase during pandemic
description: There has been a “significant increase” in stalking offences according to the UK police lead for stalking.

title: Siblings injured taking selfie as lightning struck
description: Rachel, Isobel and Andrew Jobson were injured as they took the photo during a thunderstorm.

title: South Africa Zuma riots: Death toll mounts amid looting
description: At least 30 people have died following days of unrest sparked by the jailing of a former president.

title: Firms left to decide own rules on face masks
description: Travel firms and others are setting out their own safety rules for when legal bindings lift.

title: Confusion for nightclubs over Covid pass policy
description: The government is being disingenuous by saying its guidance is voluntary, says an industry spokesman.

title: Marcus Rashford: Hundreds of messages left on mural
description: The artwork was vandalised following England's defeat by Italy in the Euro 2020 final.

title: Covid: Children missing school to protect family holidays
description: One mum says "it's something we've got to do" because her children are looking forward to a holiday.

title: England's Tyrone Mings criticises Patel over racism response
description: England's Tyrone Mings accuses the home secretary of "pretending" to be disgusted by racist abuse.

title: Colin Pitchfork: Double child killer's release confirmed
description: A judge-led review upholds a decision by the Parole Board to release double child killer Colin Pitchfork.

title: Foreign aid: MPs to vote on cut to UK budget
description: They will choose between restoring spending to previous levels or tying it to government borrowing.

title: Marcus Rashford: The wall of support and solidarity
description: Hundreds of messages adorn the vandalised mural in honour of footballer Marcus Rashford.

title: England football racism: Black and Asian fans 'so proud' of Southgate's team
description: Binta Williams, 22, is one of many new fans loving the diversity of the Euro 2020 England squad.

title: Google fined €500m by French competition authority
description: The search giant must propose ways to compensate news businesses for the use of their content.

title: Fight Talk: Tyson Fury, Anthony Joshua, Deontay Wilder, Dillian Whyte, Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez, Jake Paul
description: What does Tyson Fury v Deontay Wilder postponement mean for an undisputed Anthony Joshua-Fury clash? Plus Dillian Whyte calls out Wilder and Jake Paul trolls Conor McGregor. It's Fight Talk.

title: What's taking the knee and why was it an issue at Euro 2020?
description: Taking the knee has spread across the world as a statement against racism.

title: F1 driver Norris mugged after Euro 2020 final
description: Formula 1 driver Lando Norris was mugged and his team-issued watch stolen after the Euro 2020 final at Wembley on Sunday.

title: Covid in Scotland: Sturgeon to announce decision on restrictions
description: The First Minister will confirm whether Scotland's levels will be changed on 19 July as planned.

title: Met Police seize record £180m of cryptocurrency in London
description: The seizure is the largest of its kind in the UK - beating the previous record set just weeks ago.

title: I will never apologise for who I am - Rashford
description: England and Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford says he "will never apologise for who I am" after receiving racist abuse following England's Euro 2020 final loss to Italy.

title: What are the new sports at the Tokyo Olympic Games?
description: With 34 new events in total added to the Tokyo Olympic programme, BBC Sport takes a look at what's new.

title: The Papers: 'Ugly face of football' and 'freedom day' in England
description: Tuesday's papers react to three England players being subjected to racist abuse.

title: Uttar Pradesh bill: The myth of India's population explosion
description: India's most populous state has a contentious plan for curbing population growth. But is it necessary?

title: Plastic surgery booming in China despite the dangers
description: Young people are using social media apps to plan cosmetic procedures which don't always meet expectations.

title: In numbers: Life in Afghanistan after America leaves
description: How did 20 years of war between the US and the Taliban change Afghanistan?

title: US heatwave: Could US and Canada see the worst wildfires yet?
description: The annual fire season has barely started - and there are claims that 2021 might be the worst year yet.
